website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering for consumers who prefer an electric model w/ample features for moderate jobs.
pros: A mid-level model with user-friendly features similar to higher-priced drills
7-amp motor, 2 speeds, 2-finger locking trigger, 6-ft. cord, slide handle
cons: Some owners of previous-generation PORTER-CABLE hammer drills say it lacks the power of older models
A few reports of it overheating

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, great value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value I've found for a hammer drill that is both variable speed and reversable. This makes the drill useful for tasks other than standard hammer drilling, so it can serve as a powerful, versatile corded tool to back up a battery-powered drill. I had no trouble drilling about 30 holes in a concrete patio to install tapcon screws. A downside when drilling up or horizontally is that the tool is heavy. Hopefully, that also means it is durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ahkantel

customer_reviews.title: was very surprised........
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive hammer drill for a few projects that needed a hammer drill. After extensive research on what was available the Porter-Cable seemed to meet my criteria. When I received my order from Amazon (very quick and well packaged) I was surprised to find a very substantial hammer drill. After using it for the first time I was equally surprised, and pleased, at how this drill does its job, and does it well. I have absolutely no problem recommending the Porter-Hammer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer drill and great price
customer_reviews.text: The Porter Cable hammer Drill has met all my expectations for occasional use at a very low price for a name brand product. I doubt that porter cable is the same as in the past but my experience with their power tools has been excellent. It is possible to buy a tool that fails no matter what the brand or price however I suspect most problems occur when tools are misused and/or improperly maintained when used occasionally by non-professional everyday. As always, my go to place to shop for honest reviews, choice, value and security remains Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Oltrogge

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint was the depth-gauge got bent within the first week of owning it. Other than that, it's worked like a champ (effortlessly drilled into concrete, etc). Would definitely recommend to others. I now use this over the cordless drill and my Ryobi keyless chuck drill. I could see some people preferring a lighter-weight drill...but that hasn't been an issue for me. I also like how easy it is to remove the handle near the chuck, comes in great when working in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyOfTiredPeople

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: Nice, powerful drill that does the job. I am not happy with the lack of a hard case, though. I expect, especially from PC, a plastic or metal case for their tools. I'm supposing that the lower price brings cardbard, not plastic or metal. I'll be looking around the yard sales for a case.
customer_reviews.author: Kent W. Wetherhold

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Porter Cable is not Porter Cable quality anymore This tool should last me a life time. Not recommended. Do not waste your money on the Porter Cable. I was always a big fan of their tools, but they have cheapened them. On first use drilling a 1.5" hole in a pine 2 x 12, the gears stripped. Sintered metal gears fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: David Mason

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: When I recieved the item it was in a larger box than the item with just one piece of paper (regular thickness) as padding. So really there was no padding. Upon inspection the item had a broken piece on it (one of the knobs. The loose piece was in the box. I notified the company so they would know. They said if I returned it they would replace it. But my husband really needed the tool and he just made it work. We did not send item back.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: a real work-horse
customer_reviews.text: this is not my first Porter-Cable ... but I am impressed with the power of this unit. I am replacing 2 other 1/2inch drills (a bo--- and a sk---) both nice units but had issues that I would not put up with ..... I wanted the BEST ..and I believe that I bought just that . great weight and plenty of torque . a real work-horse
customer_reviews.author: Martin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Performs very well
customer_reviews.text: Performs the hammer drill function very well. High speed makes it possible to drill thru relatively thin and fragile materials without cracking. A relatively short distance from body to chuck centerline allows it to drill close to an obstruction (like a wall). This is also a well balanced tool making it comfortable to use. The reversing switch failed after about 40 hours of use but service provided by Porter-Cable repair center was excellent and simple to obtain. Drill probably has 100 hours of use at this time and is still working well.
customer_reviews.author: herm haven

customer_reviews.title: Good Price with Good Results
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 1/2" drill that I could use for many types of projects. I am generally a Dewalt guy and have used Porter-Cable saws at some construction site so I thought maybe a drill would be the same quality. Dewalts are generally 10% - 20% higher in costs. My initial goal was to use it with a mixing paddle for mixing a light weight cement in a 5 gallon bucket. It worked extremely well without bogging down. The mixing paddle welds actually broke from the stiff mixing action. A two speed drill motor with a hammer drill. Price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill a few holes to anchor a fence to a wall. The fore grip immediately came loose and created a very dangerous situation. No matter how tight I made it it would still come loose. I finally took it off altogether. The switch for the speed control is awkward to use, flimsy and seems like it wont last long. Outside of these two issues it seems OK for the price. It drilled through concrete block without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: SHADO PILOT

customer_reviews.title: danman
customer_reviews.text: i like this drill when i first got it, but the selector switch was made from weak plastic material and it broke and from there it was all down hill the drill did not work good from there, so i just toss it away will buy a rigid better
customer_reviews.author: danman bz

customer_reviews.title: 8 years ago and it works like the first day.
customer_reviews.text: 8 years ago and it works like the first day. This is the best tool I ever have. Noisy but very powerfull. No maintenance at all. Never complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Cio

customer_reviews.title: Used once then died
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to drill through 2 tiles. Had less than 5 minutes use. Used for 30 seconds two months later (and one month after Amazon's 30 day return window) and it died. VERY poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Custom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Pure garbage. I used this a few times and it already slips out of gear
customer_reviews.author: B. Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Porter Cable HammerDrill
customer_reviews.text: This tool is really put together from the get go .If you need a good dependable drill this is the one for you. Great feel and powerful, gets the job done in no time at all.Could of got a cheaper one at HF but not as well made. Thanks for the great deal!
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hammer drill for around the house projects. Its very heavy and sturdy with lots of power, Works great. Only suggestion I have is wear some ear plugs as it can be very loud drilling concrete. And use good drill bits as they get dull quickly. This drill is highly recommended for the casual user.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weikert

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: Half the price than at Home Depot, but just as good. 2 speed selection and high speed, with or without hammer function makes this a perfect drill for both regular and hammer drill applications.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this drill. For the money, it can't be beat if you need an occasional use hammer drill. Solidly built and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DavidCT

customer_reviews.title: In general a good product
customer_reviews.text: It's a good quality tool for light jobs, designed well, easy to handle and easy to use. Though I have noticed one thing that after a short time use, the grease starts melting even though the unit doesn't seem to be that hot, may be a high temperature grease is not used for this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Chad 003

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mix bags self leveling cement at 2bags per batch. The drill handled the job well, had plenty of power. A solid value at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: duke80

customer_reviews.title: Reamed out aluminum handle bar stem
customer_reviews.text: - as advertised - timely delivery - have yet to make use of the hammer function, but it worked well w/ a 3/4" spiral bit (1/2" spindle)....this was used to drill out an aluminum stem from the head tube (steel) of a 40 year old bicycle. The drill was smooth, powerful, and the range of variable speed was useful.
customer_reviews.author: Boltonfarm

customer_reviews.title: Good drill
customer_reviews.text: I am using this drill for 3/8 rebar into concrete. Works great after about a dozen holes. Never got very hot. It also spins fast enough for the Leigh Jig and makes clean holes. I can recommend this drill for home use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Achard

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: We have owned many hammer drills over the years, most have been really heavy and requiring two hands to operate. This one is light and durable, making it easy to drill above your head or high up on walls. Thanks Porter-Cable!
customer_reviews.author: Jakespeare

customer_reviews.title: Just as advetised!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal... even though used, it was just as the seller advertised. I always appreciate honest evaluations and descriptions of the items. Thanks, G-Man
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: I tought it was a better product
customer_reviews.text: I use this drill 2 time in 2 months . I thought it was a better product because it is a Porter Cable . The second time I use this drill was set on regular drill function, in order to drill a 4" hole for an exaust hood fan on a duble layer of exterior siding ,half made in wood shake and second layer in aluminum siding. Afther 3 minuts the drill start to smoke and smell like a rotton car tire . It was burned . This is not worth for the money , better buy a dewalt or a millwake.

customer_reviews.text: Amazon ships defective merchandise.This hammer drill didn't work when I got it. The motor whirred, but it didn't drill like it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: moocow

customer_reviews.title: Not for long term use.
customer_reviews.text: This drill worked great on the first project we did in the basement (finishing off a room). However when we went to start the next room the motor gave out after a few screws into the concrete. Porter Cable is fixing it since its only 4 months old, but we wish we would have gone with a more expensive brand. We had to rent one to finish the project and it was 100x better, of course it was a lot more expensive, but in hind sight with all the work we're going to do we shoudl have invested in a heavier duty one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Switch broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: My hubby drilled 3 holes and put it away in box. The next time he got it out to use he discovered the gear selector was in pieces in the box. Called the manufacturer and was told the whole gear box had to be replaced. By the time we paid for shipping and repairs it would have been a ridiculous investment for a cheap, poorly made drill. Don't waste your money on this drill.
customer_reviews.author: woodworker's wife

customer_reviews.title: Porter Cable PC650HD "Hammer" Drill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drill for a weekend project requiring a hammer drill. Initially I liked the price tag and the Porter Cable name. Now, However, it is my favorite tool in my tool box. It is sturdy built of metal with minimal plastic and rubber in all areas you would hold it from. The 51,000 BPM turns any concrete into dust in seconds. The 6.5 AMP motor has enough power to spin any screw or drill through just about any material with tons of torque to spare. I even made it through A 1/8"th Steel plate with this thing This drill is by far worth every penny you will spend on it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bien-Aime

customer_reviews.title: knob broke
customer_reviews.text: Plastic gear selector switch broke before I even used tool. Replacement part # 639074-00. If drill can't handle storage in a cabinet I doubt it will last long once I get around to drilling concrete.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetmaster

customer_reviews.title: Poor product reliability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased new, attached 1/2" masonry bit and was drilling my second hole in 4" concrete slab in hammer mode when motor burned out and it died. Very disappointing. Looking at buying a Bosch, we'll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Parothed11

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill
customer_reviews.text: Got it at Lowes from Dad for $70. Used it immediately with a quarter in. Bosch masonry bit on a cinder block wall and it took every bit of a few seconds to get right into the block void. Real nice drill, two speeds and it has a three year warr. on it. Duane.
customer_reviews.author: Myers

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE PC650HD 6.5 Amp 1/2-Inch Hammer Drill
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
The Porter-Cable PC650HD 1/2-Inch Hammerdrill provides the power and reliability you'll need to get the job done quickly and efficiently. With a 6.5 Amp motor for high-output power, and variable speed settings, the PC650HD gives you the performance you need drill into any virtually surface, whether it is concrete or wood.

 

Power Settings Optimized for Different Surfaces
With two speed options of either 0 to 1,000 or 0 to 3,000 revolutions-per-minute (RPMs), you can optimize your performance for high-torque/low-speed applications, such as drilling large holes into wood or drilling into masonry and concrete. And the 6.5 Amp motor produces up to 51,000 beats-per-minute (BPM), while allows the Hammerdrill to be used on thin gauge metal and other hard surfaces. The Porter-Cable Hammerdrill can also be used to drill in reverse while maintaining full power. Smart Design Ensures Durability and User Safety
Porter-Cable designed the PC650HD Hammerdrill with the professional user in mind. Employing cast metal in both the gear case and side handle increases the durability of the tool and gives you more control and safety. A soft pistol-grip design offers comfortable and safe handling position, which results in improved maneuverability and reduced fatigue.

About Porter-Cable
Since its inception in a garage in Syracuse, New York in 1906, Porter-Cable has earned its place as one of the most trusted names in power tools today. As a subsidiary of Black & Decker, and sister company of Delta Machinery, Porter-Cable designs, manufactures and distributes a wide range of electric and cordless power tools for the professional woodworking, commercial/residential construction, plumbing and electrical markets.



At the forefront of power-tool innovation, Porter-Cable introduced the first 12-volt cordless drill in 1989, and has since been awarded with many industry accolades and awards, including Time's "Top Ten Products of the Year," Popular Science's "Best of What's New," and Popular Mechanics' "Design and Engineering Award." In 1996, the Smithsonian Institution honored Porter-Cable's history of innovation by establishing the museum's first collection of archived materials from a power tool company, and in 1999 the company received one of the highest manufacturing honors when Industry Week selected Porter-Cable as one of the "Top 10 Manufacturing Plants in the United States."

Today the company continues this long tradition of innovation and quality by using state-of-the-art CNC machining centers and motor winding cells to produce the highest quality components possible. Aluminum components are carefully machined and processed to provide close tolerances and surface finish to assure proper fit and function. Critical gears and pinions are meticulously fabricated from select cut steel and then heat treated for long lasting product life. And heavy-duty series universal motors are professionally designed and processed to provide maximum horsepower as well as optimum balance to result in a smooth running product. Supported by world-class manufacturing principles, Porter-Cable continues to embody a value system that drives its industry-leading objectives in priority of safety, quality, delivery, and cost through every process in its operation.

What's in the Box
PC650HD drill, chuck key and holder, cast metal side handle, depth rod.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The PORTER-CABLE 1/2-inch hammer drill offers two speed options of either 0 to 1,000 or 0 to 3,000 revolutions-per-minute (RPM) for optimized performance in applications requiring either high-torque/low-speed or low-torque/high-speed capability. The high-output, 6.5 amp motor produces 51,000 beats-per-minute (BPM) for drilling into concrete and masonry, as well as high torque for drilling large holes into wood. Additionally, the hammer drill can be used on thin gauge metal and other hard surfaces. Featuring a motor brush system, the hammer drill ensures that full power is generated when using the drill in reverse. The hammer drill incorporates a cast metal front gear housing, an auxiliary side handle and a pistol grip-style rear handle for improved control.
